channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Virginia Advances Redistricting Plan Toward New Congressional Maps
item.description: The Democrat-controlled legislature approved an amendment that would allow redistricting next year, but the process will take months.

item.title: Powell suggested tech giants fueling the AI boom and GDP hardly care about Fed rate tweaks. They just proved him right
item.description: Powell said companies are “making money in building [data centers]—it’s not about 25 basis points here or there.”

item.title: Three billionaires dropped by a fried-chicken joint—and Jensen Huang bought everyone dinner
item.description: Nvidia’s Jensen Huang sparked a Korean-fried-chicken stock surge after a viral dinner in Seoul.

item.title: As Government Shutdown Slows Air Traffic Training, These Schools Are Stepping In
item.description: New programs cannot turn out the numbers needed to make up for the controller shortfall. But they hope to have a higher success rate than the Federal ...

item.title: Crypto’s second wave of ETFs arrives, investors snap up new Solana offering
item.description: New Litecoin and Hedera ETFs also launched, but to more modest demand.

item.title: Democrats Ride Anti-Trump Message in Final Days of California Campaign
item.description: Proponents say voters are motivated by stopping President Trump. Republicans have already begun pointing fingers over lackluster fund-raising and coor...

item.title: What Happened to the Art of the Deal?
item.description: We urge the administration to allow millions of Americans to receive food aid.

item.title: Exxon and Chevron hike oil production despite global glut and see more ‘frontier exploration’ as U.S. shale boom slows
item.description: Chevron cited more exploration efforts in Suriname, Brazil, Angola, Nigeria, Namibia, and the Middle East.

item.title: Trump may have skipped APEC—but Xi’s using it to sell China as globalization’s last defender
item.description: It’s Xi’s first visit to South Korea in 11 years.

item.title: Flooding Remains in Some of the Hardest Hit Areas in Jamaica
item.description: Three days after Hurricane Melissa hit Jamaica, floodwaters have continued to rise in St. Elizabeth Parish because of a blocked drainage system. As of...

item.title: In One Jamaican Town, Hurricane Melissa Left Behind Floodwaters and Dead Livestock
item.description: The Category 5 storm ravaged western Jamaica and drenched the small community of New River, where residents were coping with a massive clean up. At le...

item.title: Tanzania Racked by Deadly Protests After Election
item.description: As the violence continued for a third day, the United Nations said at least 10 people had been killed. Opposition leaders claimed the death toll could...

item.description: The Category 5 storm ravaged western Jamaica and drenched the small community of New River, where residents were coping with a massive clean up. At le...

item.title: Political Protests Turn Deadly in Tanzania
item.description: Post-election violence continued for the third day in Tanzania. At least 10 people have been killed, according to the United Nations.

item.title: What’s Next for Andrew After He Loses ‘Prince’ Title?
